sentences.sContent: The department occupies an office just a mile from the White House.
sentences.sCn: 该部门就在离白宫一英里远的地方有个办公楼。

sentences.sContent: Did you go to the office (= the office where you work ) today?
the increased demand for office space
sentences.sCn: 对办公室空间日益增长的需求

sentences.sContent: ...who had his office next to mine...
...the office asked for the public’s help to measure their speed results...
...We have presidential candidates running for their first term in office at age 68...
...Check with your school’s career service or employment office for help to find a campus job...
...Dean Granholm the vice president for delivery and post office operations said the first waves of closings would begin this fall...
...A lawyer from the district attorney’s office presents a case against the suspect...
...could you tell me where your office is...
...Would it be all right to come by your office around 4:00...
...Claudette also has a small office in the building downtown...
...Smith asked me to goto his office after class...

synos.tran: [管理]办公室；政府机关；官职；营业处

phrases.pCn: 办公室，行政管理办公室
n. 办公室工作；事务；内业

words.tran: 军官，警官；公务员，政府官员；船长
使官方化；使成为正式；置在政府机关管辖下

trans.tranOther: a building that belongs to a company or organization, with rooms where people can work at desks
